cab.content: From Viceroy, 1st June 1917.(Repeated to Cairo, Tehran, Meshed as 677 S.) (Received at India Office, 3 p.m.)Gj^^Secret. Afghanistan. . Monthly report. Situation remains normal and quiet. America's entry into the war has apparently had considerable moral effect. Alarming rumour regarding critical condition of Amir's health circulated through India and Afghanistan end of April. Amir, however, was only suffering from acute attack of gout and recovered sufficiently to travel from Jalalabad to Kabul middle of May.
